title: Manhunt is launched for 'chubby' Asian man who grabbed a four-year-old boy at South Windsor pool
text:
A manhunt is underway for an Asian man with a chubby build who grabbed a four-year-old boy and acted inappropriately in front of him at swimming pool toilets.

The child was approached twice by the same man at the Oasis Fitness and Aquatic Centre in South Windsor in Sydney's north-west at about 4.40pm on Thursday.

Panicked employees alerted authorities and family members after watching the man grab the child's arm as he walked past.

The child was approached twice by the same man at the Oasis Fitness and Aquatic Centre (pictured) in South Windsor in Sydney's north-west at about 4.40pm on Thursday

A family member was able to rescue the boy.

But the man confronted the boy who was with his 23-year-old brother as he entered the toilets and acted inappropriately towards the child.

The brother intervened and took the boy back to his mother before the incidents were reported to police.

The man wanted by police is described as aged between 40 and 50, of Asian appearance and is about 170cm tall with a chubby build.

There was no CCTV at centre as visual proof of the incident.

Anyone who has information about the incident, or who may know the man described, is urged to contact Windsor Police or Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000.
description: The child was approached twice by the same man at the Oasis Fitness and Aquatic Centre in South Windsor in Sydney's north-west at about 4.40pm on Thursday.
authors: Paula Ahillon For Daily Mail Australia
